definition: good people are at peace with themselves, (but) there is no rest for the wicked
pinyin: jun1 zi5 tan3 dang4 dang4 , xiao3 ren2 chang2 qi1 qi1
traditional: 君子坦蕩蕩，小人長戚戚
word: 君子坦荡荡，小人长戚戚

definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

definition: those who understand others are clever, but those who know themselves are truly wise (idiom, from Laozi's 道德經|道德经[Dao4 de2 jing1]
pinyin: zhi1 ren2 zhe3 zhi4 , zi4 zhi1 zhe3 ming2

definition: (idiom) complacency leads to loss, modesty brings profit/pride comes before a fall
pinyin: man3 zhao1 sun3 , qian1 shou4 yi4

definition: not to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on the merits of the case rather than preference between advisers
Look out for yourself, or heaven and earth will combine to destroy you./Every man for himself, and the Devil take the hindmost.
pinyin: ren2 bu4 wei4 ji3 , tian1 zhu1 di4 mie4

definition: don't blame the speaker, take note of his warning (idiom); an exhortation to speak one's mind without fear of reprisals, and with the expectation of being taken seriously
pinyin: yan2 zhe3 wu2 zui4 , wen2 zhe3 zu2 jie4

definition: study tirelessly, teach with endless enthusiasm (idiom, from Analects)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 yan4 , hui4 ren2 bu4 juan4

definition: water that is too clear has no fish, and one who is too severe has no friends (idiom)
pinyin: shui3 zhi4 qing1 ze2 wu2 yu2 , ren2 zhi4 cha2 ze2 wu2 tu2
related.word: 水至清则无鱼，人至察则无徒

definition: doing good is like a hard climb, doing evil is like an easy fall (idiom)
pinyin: cong2 shan4 ru2 deng1 , cong2 e4 ru2 beng1

definition: the unvarnished truth is better than a cunning ruse (idiom)/honesty is the best policy
pinyin: qiao3 zha4 bu4 ru2 zhuo1 cheng2

definition: A just cause attracts much support, an unjust one finds little (idiom, from Mencius)
pinyin: de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4 , shi1 dao4 gua3 zhu4

definition: He who gives no thought to far-flung problems soon finds suffering nearby (idiom, from Analects)./Smug concentration on the here and now will lead to future sorrow.
pinyin: ren2 wu2 yuan3 lu:4 , bi4 you3 jin4 you1

definition: Zai Yu sleeps by day (idiom); refers to story in Analects of Confucius remonstrating bitterly with his student for sleeping during lectures
